Known for their energetic live performances, Kataklysm continues to be a prominent force in the death metal scene.

bands.name: Triumph Of Death (Plays Hellhammer)
bands.description: Triumph Of Death is a Swiss metal band formed in 2019 by Tom Gabriel Warrior, the founder of Hellhammer and Celtic Frost. The band serves as a tribute to Hellhammer's legacy, performing their music live. The lineup includes Mia Wallace on bass, Michael Zech on guitar and vocals, and Alessandro Commerio on drums. In 2023, they released their debut live album, "Resurrection Of The Flesh," capturing performances from festivals in Houston, Munich, and Portugal. The album showcases the raw and heavy essence of Hellhammer's music, highlighting its enduring influence on the metal genre. ([metal-rules.com](https://www.metal-rules.com/2023/09/20/triumph-of-death-announce-their-debut-live-album-performing-hellhammers-resurrection-of-the-flesh/))

bands.name: Crucified Barbara
bands.description:
Crucified Barbara is an all-female Swedish hard rock and heavy metal band formed in Stockholm in 1998. Initially starting as a punk rock ensemble, they swiftly transitioned to a heavier sound, blending elements of hard rock and heavy metal. The band comprises Mia Coldheart (guitar and vocals), Klara Force (guitar and backing vocals), Ida Evileye (bass), and Nicki Wicked (drums and backing vocals). Their music is characterized by a fusion of classic heavy metal and hard rock, reminiscent of the glam metal and sleaze rock eras. ([es.wikipedia.org](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crucified_Barbara))

Their debut album, "In Distortion We Trust," was released in 2005, recorded at Pama Studios/Blakk Records in Kristianopel, Sweden, with producer Mankan Sedenberg. The album features the single "Losing the Game," which achieved notable success in Sweden. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/In_Distortion_We_Trust)) Following this, they released "'Til Death Do Us Party" in 2009, "The Midnight Chase" in 2012, and "In the Red" in 2014. In 2016, the band announced their disbandment, citing a loss of joy in playing together. However, in October 2024, they reunited and announced their first show in nearly a decade, scheduled for the Sweden Rock Festival in June 2025. ([metalinjection.net](https://metalinjection.net/news/reunited/crucified-barbara-reunites-first-show-in-roughly-10-years-booked-for-2025))

Crucified Barbara's music is available on various platforms, including their official website and Bandcamp. ([crucifiedbarbara.com](https://crucifiedbarbara.com/))

bands.name: Coroner
bands.description: Coroner is a Swiss thrash metal band formed in Zürich in 1983. Initially serving as roadies for Celtic Frost, they began creating their own music, releasing their debut album, "R.I.P.", in 1987. Their sound evolved over the years, incorporating elements of progressive, avant-garde, and industrial metal. Notable albums include "Punishment for Decadence" (1988), "No More Color" (1989), "Mental Vortex" (1991), and "Grin" (1993). After a hiatus, they reunited in 2010 and released their first studio album in over three decades, "Dissonance Theory", on October 17, 2025. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dissonance_Theory_%28album%29))

bands.name: Megadeth
bands.description: Megadeth is an American thrash metal band formed in Los Angeles in 1983 by vocalist and guitarist Dave Mustaine. After his departure from Metallica, Mustaine established Megadeth, aiming to create a faster and more aggressive sound. The band quickly rose to prominence, becoming one of the "big four" of American thrash metal alongside Metallica, Slayer, and Anthrax. Known for their technically complex guitar work and politically charged lyrics, Megadeth has released numerous influential albums, including "Peace Sells... but Who's Buying?" (1986), "Rust in Peace" (1990), and "Countdown to Extinction" (1992). Their 2022 album, "The Sick, the Dying... and the Dead!", marked a return to their thrash roots and was praised for its energy and craftsmanship. In August 2025, Megadeth announced their forthcoming album, set to be their final release, accompanied by a farewell tour in 2026. ([apnews.com](https://apnews.com/article/a750ed8043c0fdbc472b472e604f4446)) The current lineup includes Dave Mustaine (vocals, guitar), James LoMenzo (bass), Dirk Verbeuren (drums), and Teemu Mäntysaari (guitar). ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/bands/megadeth/138))

bands.name: Feuerschwanz
bands.description: Feuerschwanz is a German medieval metal band formed in 2004 in Erlangen, Bavaria. Initially conceived as a comedic medieval folk rock ensemble, the band has evolved over the years into a serious heavy metal act. Their early music was characterized by humorous lyrics and brash language, often incorporating innuendo. In 2020, after signing with Napalm Records, Feuerschwanz shifted towards a more serious heavy metal style with the release of "Das elfte Gebot." This marked a significant change in their musical direction, moving away from their comedic roots. The band's lineup includes Hauptmann Feuerschwanz (vocals, guitar, lute), Johanna von der Vögelweide (violin, hurdy-gurdy), and Prinz R. Hodenherz "Hodi" III (vocals, guitar, flute, mandolin, Irish bouzouki, bagpipes, various whistles). Other members include Hela (dance, animations), Jan Jamaszyk (bass, vocals), Rollo H. Schönhaar (drums), and Jenny Diehl (dance, animations). Feuerschwanz has released several studio albums, with "Fegefeuer" (2023) reaching number one on the official German charts. Their twelfth studio album, "Knightclub," was released on August 22, 2025, continuing their journey in the folk metal genre.

members.name: Prinz R. Hodenherz "Hodi" III
members.role: Vocals, Guitar, Flute, Mandolin, Irish Bouzouki, Bagpipes, Various Whistles

bands.name: Arthur Brown
bands.description: Arthur Brown is an English singer and songwriter, renowned for his flamboyant and theatrical performances, eclectic musical style, and powerful, wide-ranging operatic voice. Born on June 24, 1942, in Whitby, North Yorkshire, England, he first gained prominence in the late 1960s as the frontman of The Crazy World of Arthur Brown. The band's 1968 debut album, 'The Crazy World of Arthur Brown,' featured the hit single 'Fire,' which reached number one in the UK and Canada and number two in the United States. This track sold over one million copies and was awarded a gold disc. Brown's music encompasses psychedelic soul, soul, blues, British rhythm and blues, pop, acid rock, psychedelia, psychedelic rock, progressive rock, shock rock, and experimental music. His theatrical stage presence, including face paint and a flaming helmet, influenced artists like Alice Cooper, David Bowie, and Marilyn Manson. Over the years, Brown has released several solo albums and collaborated with various artists, including Hawkwind and Klaus Schulze. In 2022, he released 'Long Long Road' on his 80th birthday, followed by 'Monster's Ball' later that year. In 2025, he announced a UK and European tour, continuing to captivate audiences with his unique blend of music and performance art.

bands.name: Subway To Sally
bands.description: Subway To Sally is a German folk metal band formed in Potsdam in 1990. Their music blends medieval and folk influences with metal elements, incorporating instruments like bagpipes, hurdy-gurdy, shawm, violin, lute, mandolin, and flutes. Over the years, they've released 12 studio albums, including 'Album 1994', 'MCMXCV' (1995), 'Foppt den Dämon!' (1996), 'Bannkreis' (1997), 'Hochzeit' (1999), 'Schrei!' (2000), 'Herzblut' (2001), 'Engelskrieger' (2004), 'Bastard' (2007), 'Schlachthof' (2008), 'Kreuzfeuer' (2009), 'Schwarz in Schwarz' (2010), 'Hey!' (2019), 'Himmelfahrt' (2023), and 'Post Mortem' (2024). Their 2024 album 'Post Mortem' was released via Napalm Records. ([label.napalmrecords.com](https://label.napalmrecords.com/subway-to-sally))

bands.name: Black Label Society
bands.description: Black Label Society is an American heavy metal band formed in Los Angeles in 1998 by guitarist and vocalist Zakk Wylde. The band emerged after Wylde's solo project, Pride & Glory, disbanded in 1994. Initially named Hell's Kitchen, they changed their name to Black Label Society due to trademark issues. Their debut album, "Sonic Brew," released in 1999, showcased a blend of heavy metal and southern rock influences. Over the years, the band has released numerous albums, including "1919 Eternal" (2002), "The Blessed Hellride" (2003), and "Catacombs of the Black Vatican" (2014). Their music is characterized by heavy guitar riffs, soulful melodies, and themes of rebellion and freedom. The current lineup includes Zakk Wylde (vocals, lead guitar, piano), John DeServio (bass, backing vocals), Dario Lorina (rhythm guitar, backing vocals), and Jeff Fabb (drums). They continue to tour and release new material, maintaining a dedicated fan base worldwide.

bands.name: The Ocean
bands.description: The Ocean is a German post-metal band formed in 2000 by guitarist Robin Staps. Known for their atmospheric and experimental sound, they have explored various subgenres, including progressive metal, sludge metal, and avant-garde metal. Over the years, the band has undergone several lineup changes, with Staps remaining the constant member. Their discography includes notable albums such as "Fluxion" (2004), "Aeolian" (2006), "Precambrian" (2007), "Heliocentric" and "Anthropocentric" (2010), "Pelagial" (2013), "Phanerozoic I: Palaeozoic" (2018), "Phanerozoic II: Mesozoic / Cenozoic" (2020), and "Holocene" (2023). In 2025, significant departures occurred, including vocalist Loïc Rossetti, guitarist David Ramis Åhfeldt, and drummer Paul Seidel. Despite these changes, the band announced plans for a new album in 2026, signaling their commitment to continue creating music.

bands.name: Municipal Waste
bands.description: Municipal Waste is an American crossover thrash band from Richmond, Virginia, formed in 2000. Known for their high-energy performances and humorous lyrics, they have been a significant force in the revival of thrash metal. Their music is characterized by fast-paced riffs, aggressive drumming, and themes of partying, politics, and societal issues. The band has released seven studio albums, including "Waste 'Em All" (2003), "Hazardous Mutation" (2005), "The Art of Partying" (2007), "Massive Aggressive" (2009), "The Fatal Feast" (2012), "Slime and Punishment" (2017), and "Electrified Brain" (2022). They have also produced three EPs and four split albums. Their 2007 album, "The Art of Partying," was particularly influential, being named one of the "50 Greatest Thrash Metal Albums Ever" by Metal Hammer. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Municipal_Waste_%28band%29)) The current lineup consists of Tony Foresta (vocals), Ryan Waste (guitar), Philip "Land Phil" Hall (bass), Dave Witte (drums), and Nick "Nikropolis" Poulos (lead guitar). ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Municipal_Waste_%28band%29))

bands.name: Crippling Alcoholism
bands.description: Crippling Alcoholism is a gothic noise rock band from New England, formed in 2022 by vocalist Tony Castrati and drummer Danny Sher. Their music blends abrasive noise textures with a suffocating gothic atmosphere, creating a unique and unrelenting sound. The band's debut album, "When the Drugs that Made You Sick are the Drugs that Make You Better," released in 2022, circulated through niche music boards, earning a cult following. In 2024, the band expanded into a six-piece with the addition of guitarist Alyce, guitarist Stefan, bassist Peter, and synthesist Jonathan, evolving their sonic palette into something broader and more unhinged. Their third album, "Camgirl," released on September 12, 2025, tells the tragic tale of "Bella Pink," an online performer whose story unfolds through the eyes of those who consume her: lovers, relatives, business partners, and stalkers. Musically, the album embraces dance music, party pop, and synthetic ecstasy, while lyrically exploring themes of lust, power, exploitation, and disintegration. The current lineup includes Tony Castrati (vocals), Danny Sher (drums), Alyce (guitar), Stefan (guitar), Peter (bass), and Jonathan (synthesizer).

bands.name: Wargasm
bands.description: Wargasm is a British electronic rock duo from London, formed in 2018 by Sam Matlock and Milkie Way. Matlock, previously part of Dead!, and Way, a former concert photographer, bonded over a shared love of nu metal acts like Limp Bizkit. Initially writing pop-punk songs, they shifted towards a fusion of rap and nu metal, leading to the formation of Wargasm in August 2019. The band's music is characterized by a blend of electro-punk, digital hardcore, nu metal, and post-hardcore elements. Their debut mixtape, "Explicit: The Mixxxtape," released in September 2022, charted at No. 19 on the UK Rock & Metal Albums Chart. In October 2023, they released their first full-length album, "Venom," which peaked at No. 88 on the UK Albums Chart. The duo has been recognized with several accolades, including the New Noise Award at the 2022 Kerrang! Awards and Best UK Breakthrough Band at the 2021 Heavy Music Awards. Their energetic performances and distinctive sound have established them as a prominent act in the modern rock scene.

bands.name: Knorkator
bands.description:
Knorkator is a German band from Berlin, formed in 1994, known for blending heavy metal with comedic elements. They humorously describe themselves as "Germany's most beloved band in the world." The name "Knorkator" is derived from "knorke," a Berlin dialect term meaning "great" or "fabulous." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Knorkator))

The band's music is characterized by industrial metal influences, akin to White Zombie and Ministry, infused with satirical and explicit lyrics. Their performances are renowned for their wild stage shows, featuring antics like smashing TV sets and throwing toast at the audience. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Knorkator))

Knorkator gained national attention in 2000 with their song "Ick wer zun Schwein," which led to their participation in the German national qualification for the Eurovision Song Contest. Despite announcing their breakup in 2008, they reunited in 2011, releasing the album "Es werde Nicht" and embarking on a tour. Their latest album, "Weltherrschaft für alle," was released in September 2025. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Knorkator))

The current lineup includes:

- **Gero Ivers** (Stumpen) – vocals
- **Alexander Thomas** (Alf Ator) – keyboards, vocals
- **Sebastian Baur** (Buzz Dee) – guitars
- **Rajko Gohlke** – bass
- **Philipp Schwab** – drums

Their music is available on platforms like Apple Music. ([music.apple.com](https://music.apple.com/us/artist/knorkator/84630084))

For more information, visit their official website at [knorkator.de](https://www.knorkator.de/).

bands.name: Future Palace
bands.description: Future Palace is a German post-hardcore and alternative rock band formed in Berlin in 2018. The lineup consists of vocalist Maria Lessing, guitarist Manuel Kohlert, and drummer Johannes Früchtenicht. The band signed with Arising Empire in 2020 and released their debut album, "Escape," on September 18, 2020. Their second album, "Run," followed on June 10, 2022, and their third album, "Distortion," was released on September 6, 2024. In September 2025, Future Palace signed with Century Media Records and released the single "Cyclone." Their music blends post-hardcore and alternative rock with influences from 80s synth-pop and electronica. Lyrically, they explore themes of personal experiences, depression, inner conflicts, and toxic relationships. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Future_Palace))

bands.name: Static-X
bands.description: Static-X is an American industrial metal band formed in Los Angeles, California, in 1994. The band was founded by vocalist and guitarist Wayne Static and drummer Ken Jay. Over the years, Static-X has been known for its unique "Evil Disco" style, blending heavy metal with electronic elements. Their debut album, "Wisconsin Death Trip," released in 1999, achieved platinum status and featured the hit single "Push It." The band's discography includes several albums, such as "Machine" (2001), "Shadow Zone" (2003), "Start a War" (2005), "Cannibal" (2007), and "Cult of Static" (2009). After Wayne Static's passing in 2014, the surviving members reunited in 2018 with a new vocalist, Xer0, to honor his legacy and continue the band's musical journey. In 2020, they released "Project Regeneration Vol. 1," featuring previously unreleased tracks with Wayne Static's vocals. The follow-up, "Project Regeneration Vol. 2," was released in 2023, further solidifying Static-X's enduring presence in the metal scene.

bands.name: Enslaved
bands.description: Enslaved is a Norwegian extreme metal band formed in 1991 by Ivar Bjørnson and Grutle Kjellson in Haugesund. Initially rooted in black metal, they have evolved into a progressive black and Viking metal sound, drawing heavily on Norse mythology and Viking heritage. Their discography includes notable albums such as "Vikingligr Veldi" (1994), "Frost" (1994), "Eld" (1997), "Vertebrae" (2008), and "Heimdal" (2023). The current lineup features Ivar Bjørnson (guitar, keyboards), Grutle Kjellson (vocals, bass), Arve Isdal (guitar), Håkon Vinje (keyboard, vocals), and Iver Sandøy (drums).

bands.name: Uuhai
bands.description: Uuhai is a Mongolian folk metal band formed in 2020, known for blending traditional Mongolian instruments and throat singing with modern metal elements. The band's name, "Uuhai," translates to "hoo-rah," a chant historically used by heroic men to unite their voices in battle, symbolizing strength and unity. This cultural heritage is reflected in their music, which incorporates instruments like the Morin Khuur (horsehead fiddle) and the Tovshuur, alongside modern metal instrumentation. Their vocal style features Khoomei, a form of throat singing, adding a unique depth to their sound. Uuhai's discography includes singles such as "Secret History of the Mongols," released in 2022, showcasing their ability to tell tales from Mongolian mythology and history through music. The band has gained international recognition, performing at festivals like Hornerfest, Leyendas del Rock, and Bloodstock Open Air, captivating audiences with their distinctive fusion of traditional and modern sounds. Their performances often feature traditional Mongolian garments and instruments, creating an immersive cultural experience for listeners.

bands.name: Stam1Na
bands.description: Stam1na is a Finnish metal band formed in 1996 in Lemi, South Karelia. Initially a trio, the lineup expanded over the years to include bassist Kai-Pekka "Kaikka" Kangasmäki in 2005 and keyboardist Emil "Hippi" Lähteenmäki in 2009. Their music is characterized by a blend of thrash metal with progressive, death, alternative, and punk influences, all performed in Finnish. The band is known for using seven-string guitars on most albums, with some tracks composed for eight-string guitars on their eighth album, "Taival". Their self-titled debut album, released in 2005, reached No. 13 on the Finnish album charts. Subsequent albums, such as "Uudet kymmenen käskyä" (2006) and "Raja" (2008), achieved even greater success, topping the charts in Finland. In 2012, "Nocebo" topped the Finnish album chart and was certified gold on the day of its release. Their sixth album, "SLK", was released in February 2014. In 2016, they released "Elokuutio", followed by "Taival" in 2018. Their eighth studio album, "Taival", was released in 2018. The band has also toured internationally, including performances on the 70,000 Tons of Metal cruise in 2017 and as part of the "Arctic Circle Alliance" with Skálmöld and Omnium Gatherum (2017-2018).

bands.name: From Fall To Spring
bands.description: From Fall To Spring is a German metalcore band formed in 2008 in Neunkirchen, Saarland. Initially known as Basement Project, the group began with brothers Philip and Lukas Wilhelm, along with Benedikt Veith, Matthias Hansen, and Marius Meinecke. They released two self-produced EPs, 'A Better Tomorrow' in 2017 and 'Disconnected' in 2019, amassing over one million streams. Their debut album, 'RISE,' released in April 2023 under Arising Empire, charted at #73 on the German Albums Chart and garnered over 20 million streams. The band's style blends metalcore with elements of nu-metal and post-hardcore, drawing comparisons to acts like Bring Me the Horizon and Architects. In 2025, they released their second album, 'ENTRY WOUNDS,' showcasing a more introspective sound. The current lineup includes twin brothers Philip and Lukas Wilhelm (vocals and guitar), Simon Triem (keyboard), Sebastian Monzel (guitar), León Arend (bass), and Benedikt Veith (drums). ([fromfalltospring.de](https://fromfalltospring.de/))

bands.name: Marduk
bands.description: Marduk is a Swedish black metal band formed in Norrköping in 1990. The band's name is derived from the Babylonian storm god Marduk, chosen to convey a blasphemous irony, as the deity represents light, contrasting with the band's dark themes. ([metal-temple.com](https://metal-temple.com/review/marduk-memento-mori/)) Their debut album, "Dark Endless," released in 1992, combined black metal with death metal elements. Subsequent albums like "Those of the Unlight" (1993) and "Opus Nocturne" (1994) showcased a more melodic black metal approach, with "Opus Nocturne" introducing faster blast beats. The 1996 album "Heaven Shall Burn... When We Are Gathered" marked a shift towards hyper-blast beats and raw vocals, solidifying their reputation for intensity. Throughout their career, Marduk has been known for their aggressive style and controversial themes, often exploring topics like war, death, and Satanism. Their discography includes notable albums such as "Nightwing" (1998), "Panzer Division Marduk" (1999), and "Frontschwein" (2015). The band's lineup has evolved over the years, with guitarist Morgan Steinmeyer Håkansson being the consistent member. As of 2025, the current lineup includes vocalist Mortuus, guitarist Morgan Steinmeyer Håkansson, bassist Simon, and drummer Bloodhammer. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marduk_%28band%29))

bands.name: Nevermore
bands.description: Nevermore is an American heavy metal band from Seattle, Washington, formed in 1992. The band was established by vocalist Warrel Dane, bassist Jim Sheppard, and guitarist Jeff Loomis after their previous band, Sanctuary, disbanded. They were later joined by drummer Van Williams in 1994. Nevermore's music is characterized by a fusion of progressive metal, thrash metal, power metal, and classic heavy metal, often incorporating elements of death metal. Their debut album, "Nevermore," was released in 1995, followed by "The Politics of Ecstasy" in 1996. The band underwent several lineup changes over the years, with notable members including guitarist Pat O'Brien and drummer Tim Calvert. After a hiatus in 2011, the band reunited in 2024, with Loomis and Williams announcing plans for a new lineup and performances in 2025. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nevermore))

bands.name: Thy Art Is Murder
bands.description:
Thy Art Is Murder is an Australian deathcore band formed in 2006 in Blacktown, New South Wales. The band has released six studio albums:

- **The Adversary** (2010): Debut album featuring vocalist Chris "CJ" McMahon, guitarist Sean Delander, bassist Mick Low, and drummer Lee Stanton. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Adversary_%28Thy_Art_Is_Murder_album%29))

- **Hate** (2012): The band's second album, which debuted at No. 35 on the ARIA Charts, making them the first extreme metal band to break the top 40. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hate_%28Thy_Art_Is_Murder_album%29))

- **Holy War** (2015): Released on 26 June 2015, it debuted at No. 7 in Australia and No. 82 in the U.S. ([es.wikipedia.org](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Holy_War_%28%C3%A1lbum_de_Thy_Art_Is_Murder%29))

- **Dear Desolation** (2017): Released on 18 August 2017 by Nuclear Blast. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dear_Desolation))

- **Human Target** (2019): Released on 26 July 2019 through Nuclear Blast Records. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thy_Art_Is_Murder))

- **Godlike** (2023): Released on 22 September 2023. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Thy_Art_Is_Murder/Godlike/1136799))

The band's music is characterized by aggressive guitar riffs, intricate drum patterns, and guttural vocals, blending elements of death metal with hardcore influences. Their lyrics often delve into dark and personal topics, appealing to fans who appreciate raw emotion in music.

The current lineup includes vocalist Tyler Miller, guitarists Sean Delander and Andy Marsh, bassist Kevin Butler, and drummer Jesse Beahler. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thy_Art_Is_Murder))

([thyartismurder.net](https://www.thyartismurder.net/))

bands.name: President
bands.description: President (stylized as PRESIDENT) is an anonymous English metal band formed in 2025. The band emerged with a mysterious image, featuring a frontman known as The President, who is described as having silver hair and wearing an eerie, lifelike mask. The lineup includes Heist (guitarist), Protest (bassist), and Vice (drummer). Their debut single, "In the Name of the Father," was released on May 15, 2025, followed by "Fearless" on June 5, 2025. The band's debut EP, "King of Terrors," was released on September 26, 2025, showcasing their blend of alternative metal with electronic and cinematic elements. The EP includes tracks like "Rage," which is described as a "swirling, synth-laden cut," and "Destroy Me," released on September 4, 2025. The band has been praised for their theatrical live performances, including their debut at the Download Festival in June 2025. They are set to headline the TakeDown Festival 2026 in April 2026.

bands.name: Beyond The Black
bands.description: Beyond the Black is a German symphonic metal band formed in Mannheim in 2014. Their debut album, "Songs of Love and Death," released in 2015, achieved immediate success, entering the German and Austrian music charts. The band's lineup has evolved over time, with vocalist Jennifer Haben being the consistent member. Their music is characterized by powerful vocals, orchestral elements, and a blend of metal subgenres. They have released several albums, including "Lost in Forever" (2016), "Heart of the Hurricane" (2018), "Hørizøns" (2020), and their self-titled album "Beyond the Black" (2023). The band has toured extensively, performing at major European festivals and supporting acts like Aerosmith, Korn, and Within Temptation. In 2024, they embarked on their most successful European headline tour to date, "Dancing in the Dark," and announced their upcoming "Rising High" tour set to begin in January 2026. ([beyond-the-black.com](https://beyond-the-black.com/))

bands.name: Linkin Park
bands.description:
Linkin Park is an American rock band formed in Agoura Hills, California, in 1996. The band's current lineup consists of vocalist/rhythm guitarist/keyboardist Mike Shinoda, lead guitarist Brad Delson, DJ/turntablist Joe Hahn, bassist Dave Farrell, vocalist Emily Armstrong, and drummer Colin Brittain. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linkin_Park))

The band rose to prominence with their debut album, "Hybrid Theory" (2000), which blended alternative rock, nu metal, and electronic elements, earning them a global fanbase. They followed up with "Meteora" (2003), solidifying their status in the rock scene. After the tragic death of lead vocalist Chester Bennington in 2017, the band went on hiatus. In 2024, they returned with "From Zero," featuring Armstrong as the new vocalist, marking a new chapter in their musical journey. ([apnews.com](https://apnews.com/article/61e0de30548b90932fe1d4102a07641d))

"From Zero" debuted at number one in 14 countries and includes the hit single "The Emptiness Machine," which became the most-streamed rock song of 2024. The band embarked on the "From Zero World Tour" in 2025, performing in North America, Latin America, Oceania, and Europe. ([linkinparktour.org](https://www.linkinparktour.org/))

Linkin Park's music is characterized by a fusion of heavy guitar riffs, hip-hop rhythms, and electronic textures, creating anthemic, high-energy sound that has reshaped modern rock. ([linkinparktour.org](https://www.linkinparktour.org/))

For more information, visit their official website: https://www.linkinpark.com/

bands.name: Inhuman Nature
bands.description: Formed in 2017 in London, Inhuman Nature is a dynamic crossover thrash metal band that seamlessly blends the raw energy of hardcore punk with the aggressive riffage of thrash metal. Drawing inspiration from 1980s legends like D.R.I. and Cryptic Slaughter, they have rapidly established themselves as a formidable force in the UK metal scene. Their debut EP, "Under the Boot," released in 2019 via Clobber Records, showcased their relentless energy and set the stage for their self-titled debut album in 2023. Building on this momentum, they released "Greater Than Death" in April 2025 through Church Road Records. This sophomore album captures the band's live fury with a mix that is crisp, raw, and crushing, featuring tracks like "Possessed to Die" and "Servants of Annihilation." Known for their electrifying live performances, Inhuman Nature has toured extensively across the UK and Europe, sharing stages with acts such as Crowbar, High Command, Heriot, and Grove Street. Their music is characterized by fast, relentless tempos and anthemic choruses, making them a staple in the crossover thrash genre.

bands.name: Draconian
bands.description: Draconian is a Swedish gothic metal and death-doom band formed in 1994 in Säffle. Initially known as Kerberos, the band underwent a lineup change when vocalist and lyricist Anders Jacobsson joined, leading to the name change to Draconian. Their first demo, "Shades of a Lost Moon," was recorded in 1995 but did not secure a recording contract. In 2002, they released "Dark Oceans We Cry," featuring vocalist Lisa Johansson, which garnered positive reviews and led to a deal with Napalm Records. Their debut album, "Where Lovers Mourn," was released in 2003, followed by "Arcane Rain Fell" in 2005. In 2011, "A Rose for the Apocalypse" was released, and in 2015, "Sovran" introduced vocalist Heike Langhans. "Under a Godless Veil," released in 2020, marked the band's return with Johansson after Langhans's departure. The band's music is characterized by a melancholic atmosphere, blending heavy doom riffs with orchestral arrangements and contrasting deep growls with clean vocals.

bands.name: Predatory Void
bands.description: Predatory Void is a Belgian metal band formed in 2022 in Ghent, Belgium. The band emerged from the 'Church of Ra' collective, which includes members from Amenra and Oathbreaker. The formation began when Lennart Bossu, known for his work with Amenra and Oathbreaker, started composing material that didn't align with his primary bands. Seeking a new musical outlet, he gathered vocalist Lina R, guitarist Thijs de Cloedt, bassist Tim De Gieter, and drummer Vincent Verstrepen to bring this project to life. Their music blends elements of black, sludge, and death metal, characterized by heavy, distorted guitar riffs, deep basslines, and atmospheric vocals. Lyrically, they explore themes of depression, anger, and anxiety, delving into the darker aspects of human existence. In April 2023, they released their debut album, "Seven Keys to the Discomfort of Being," via Century Media Records. The album features tracks like "Grovel," "*(struggling..)," and "Endless Return to the Kingdom of Sleep." The band has performed at notable festivals such as Soulcrusher and Roadburn, gaining recognition for their intense live performances. In November 2023, bassist Tim De Gieter left the band to focus on other projects, and Kris Auman joined as the new bassist.

bands.name: The Offspring
bands.description: The Offspring is an American rock band formed in Garden Grove, California, in 1984. Originally known as Manic Subsidal, the band consists of lead vocalist and guitarist Bryan "Dexter" Holland, lead guitarist Kevin "Noodles" Wasserman, bassist Todd Morse, multi-instrumentalist Jonah Nimoy, and drummer Brandon Pertzborn. They are recognized for their energetic performances and catchy tunes, contributing significantly to the mainstream popularity of punk rock in the 1990s. Their 1994 album "Smash" sold over 11 million copies worldwide, making it one of the best-selling independent albums of all time. In 2024, they released their eleventh studio album, "Supercharged," featuring singles like "Make It All Right" and "Light It Up." The band is currently on the "Supercharged Worldwide in '25 Tour," performing across North America, Europe, and Australia. ([superchargedworldwidein25.com](https://superchargedworldwidein25.com/))

bands.name: Motorjesus
bands.description: Motorjesus is a German hard rock band formed in 1990 in Mönchengladbach, originally under the name The Shitheadz. They changed their name to Motorjesus in 2006, inspired by a track from their debut album. The band's music blends heavy metal and hard rock, characterized by powerful riffs and energetic performances. Their discography includes several albums, such as "Dirty Pounding Gasoline" (2011), "Race to Resurrection" (2018), and "Hellbreaker" (2021). In 2025, they released "Streets of Fire," featuring tracks like "Somewhere from Beyond" and "New Messiah of Steel." The current lineup consists of vocalist Chris Birx, guitarist Andreas Peters, guitarist Patrick Wassenberg, bassist Dominik Kwasny, and drummer Adam Borosch.

bands.name: Electric Callboy
bands.description: Electric Callboy, formerly known as Eskimo Callboy, is a German electronicore band formed in Castrop-Rauxel in 2010. They are renowned for blending metalcore with electronic elements, creating a distinctive sound characterized by energetic performances and humorous videos. The band's early releases include their self-titled EP in 2010 and their debut album, "Bury Me in Vegas," released in 2012. In 2014, they released "We Are the Mess," which peaked at number 8 on the German charts. The 2017 album "The Scene" featured the popular single "MC Thunder." In 2019, they released "Rehab," followed by the EP "MMXX" in 2020. A significant turning point came in 2020 with the release of "Hypa Hypa," which achieved gold certification and marked the band's rebranding to Electric Callboy. Their 2022 album "Tekkno" debuted at number 1 on the German charts. In 2024, they collaborated with Japanese metal band BABYMETAL on the single "RATATATA," which gained international attention. In 2025, they released singles "Elevator Operator" and "Revery," showcasing their evolving musical style.
